{{cpp/title|rename}}
{{cpp/io/c/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=cstdio|
int rename( const char* old_filename, const char* new_filename );
}}

Changes the filename of a file. The file is identified by character string pointed to by {{c|old_filename}}. The new filename is identified by character string pointed to by {{c|new_filename}}.

If {{c|new_filename}} exists, the behavior is implementation-defined.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|old_filename|pointer to a null-terminated string containing the path identifying the file to rename}}
{{par|new_filename|pointer to a null-terminated string containing the new path of the file}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
{{c|0}} upon success or non-zero value on error.

===Notes===
[https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/functions/rename.html POSIX] specifies many additional details on the semantics of this function, which are reproduced in C++ by {{lc|std::filesystem::rename}}.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;cstdio&gt;
#include &lt;cstdlib&gt;
#include &lt;fstream&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    if (!std::ofstream("from.txt").put('a')) // create and write to file
    {
        std::perror("Error creating from.txt");
        return EXIT_FAILURE;
    }

    if (std::rename("from.txt", "to.txt"))
    {
        std::perror("Error renaming");
        return EXIT_FAILURE;
    }

    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::ifstream("to.txt").rdbuf() &lt;&lt; '\n'; // print file
    return EXIT_SUCCESS;
}
|output=
a
}}
